questions.text: How often must a PSUR be submitted for a Class IIb medical device?

options.explanation: Six months exceeds the required frequency for Class IIb.
Per Section 5.6, PSURs for Class IIb and III devices are submitted annually.
Every 2 years applies to Class IIa devices, not Class IIb.
Five years is far too infrequent for any device class.

questions.text: What is the first action when a safety signal is detected during PMS?

options.explanation: Recalls are not automatic; signal strength must be assessed first.

options.text: Assess signal strength and clinical significance
options.explanation: Per Section 5.4, the first step is to assess the signal's strength and clinical significance before taking action.
Marketing updates are not the immediate response to safety signals.
PSURs are periodic reports; safety signals require immediate assessment.

questions.text: PMS plans must be reviewed and updated at least every two years.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.1, PMS plans are reviewed annually and updated as needed, not every two years.

questions.text: Which of the following is a proactive PMS data source?

options.explanation: Complaints are reactive data â€” they arrive after an issue occurs.
Per Section 5.2, scientific literature is a proactive data source collected through periodic searches.
FSCAs are reactive responses to identified issues.

questions.text: When PMS data reveals a confirmed safety issue, which document must be updated?

options.explanation: Marketing materials are not the primary document to update for safety issues.
Per Section 5.4, confirmed safety issues require updating the risk management file per SOP-003.
The employee handbook is not related to product safety issues.
The supplier list is not directly affected by product safety findings.
